column4: in 7.04, I have beryl running, but the settings menu is not comeing up
How do I get the beryl settings menu to come up?
beryl-manager
I want the setting menu
The menu were I can enable rain and stuff like that
when I type the command you gave me, it comes up with a menu that you would get if you right clicked
The setting manager? what command do I type
:P That comes up with a menu that you would normally get if you right clicked something
What settings folder? I just upgraded to 7.10
When I mark beryl for remove, it only marks a few other folders, should I delet everything with beryl?
How do I re-install everything?
Wait, what folders?
there is a beryl-core, beryl-pluggins and some other stuff, but not just beryl
Have you enabled restricted software sources?
I don't think so, how do I do that?
Beryl didn't install properly
No, I am seeing if the update manager is taking care of it
Thanks for all you are doing
I checked it off and installed it, but it isn't showing up in my menu, only bery settings maneger is
Ahhh - I thought u were still installing
Command not found
#cotton
